p: Thymol was the only constituent present in all the organs of L. thymoides and was the main component of the oils of the flowers, leaves, and branches. This oxygenated monoterpenoid varied among all the plant organs from 19.34% (FR) to 66.33% (FLE). In the three parts where thymol was the main component. In addition, for the fourth plant sample, quantitative variations in p-cymene (0.07% FFL and 8.36% DLE), β-caryophyllene (1.29% FB and 9.55% FFL), γ-terpinene (0.15% FFL and 15.06% DFL), and thymol acetate (5.07% FB and 33.81% FFL) were observed.
